Record.Term: Yttrium Y 90 Anti-CD45 Monoclonal Antibody AHN-12
Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Radiopharmaceutical Compound/Radioimmunoconjugate/Yttrium Y 90 Anti-CD45 Monoclonal Antibody AHN-12
Record.BroaderTerm: Yttrium Y 90 Anti-CD45 Monoclonal Antibody AHN-12
Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Synonym: Yttrium Y 90 Anti-CD45 Monoclonal Antibody AHN-12
Record.Description: A radioimmunoconjugate comprised of the monoclonal antibody AHN-12 conjugated to the radioisotope yttrium 90 with potential radioimmunotherapeutic activity. Yttrium Y 90 monoclonal antibody AHN-12 binds to the tyrosine phosphatase CD45, expressed on the surface of normal and malignant hematopoietic cells. After binding and internalization by CD45-expressing tumor cells, this agent may deliver a cytotoxic dose of beta radiation.
